As we think about the Fall and the beginning of the 2020-2021 school year, we are actively preparing for 3 scenarios:

1. In-Person Instruction - all students return to the school building for in-person instruction
.
2. Remote Instruction - all students are engaged in remote instruction
.
3. Blended Learning - students engage in a blend of in-person instruction and remote instruction, to reduce the number of individuals in the school building at one time
.
By planning for all possibilities, we will be able to pivot quickly should the Covid-19 crisis either resolve or escalate again.

💻Parents -- please complete the REOPENING SURVEY to give us more information as we plan!
.
📧The survey links were emailed to all families earlier this week in English and Spanish
.
*If you did not receive the survey, please email Main_Office@bwccs2.org

👩🏽‍🎓👨🏾‍🎓 Hats off to the Graduating 5th Grade Class of 2020!!
.
👏🏾 We are so proud of ALL that you have accomplished at B2. But more importantly, we are proud of the kind and determined leaders that each of you are.
.
You finished school in a historic way--by learning remotely, which was no simple task. As Mr Ferrara said, "Take this experience with you as you go to middle school, high school, college and beyond. Be resilient. Be strong. Be honest with yourself and others. And always do your best."
.
🙋🏽‍♀️🙋🏾‍♂️ Don't forget the lessons you learned from B2 and don't forget to come back and visit, often!
.
❤ Graduates, CONGRATULATION!!!! Be great and make us proud!
.
To our amazing families--thank you for entrusting us to help teach and guide your beautiful children. We are so grateful for the love and support you gave the school throughout the years and wouldn't be the community we are today without you.
.
.
.
